resources.string: In this app we want to evaluate the performance of our speech emotion recognition model. I this app we will ask you to record voice messages in 5 different emotional states: neutral, happy, sad, angry, fearful. To bring you into an emotional state. We will describe a situation for each emotion and ask you to record a response to the given situation. But this are just examples. If you have an better idea you can also record an different text. Important is that you try to do it in the given emotional state. The duration of you record should be around 1 minute or longer.

In the end we will ask you to share the results with us. So that we can evaluate them. Your records are analyzed on the device (NOT in the cloud) and will NOT be part of the send and analyzed data. Only the requested emotional state and the classification results are part of it. If you continue with the next steps you allow us to automatically analyze you records.

This is the test run. It will make you familiar with the app. Please speak in English and record around 60 seconds.


How to use the App:

  1. Press on the button on the bottom left to start the recording
  2. Press the button again to stop the recording
  3. Press it again to go to the next task

Record a voice message in a neutral state.


For Example:

  • Describe your surroundings and the weather in a neutral way

Record a voice message in a happy emotion.


For Example:

  • Tell some happy or funny stories which happened to you or someone else today or during the week.
  • Talk about how you handled a successful project at work or in the university which you are proud of.

Record a voice message about something which makes you really sad.


For Example:

  • Tell a sad story which happened to you or someone else today or during the week.
  • Talk about something which you regret doing or not doing.

Record a voice message where you complain about something which makes you really angry.


For Example:

  • The wrong behaviour of a stranger or one of your friends.
  • How your boss or your professors requesting you to do much more work, ignoring the fact that you also have other things to do.
  • Your imaginary flatmate Jerry which did AGAIN “forgot” to clean the dishes.

Talk about a creepy experience or something which scared you.


For Example:

  • A creepy person which followed you on you way home.
  • A mad or insane person you had contact with or heard about.
Thank you for helping us to evaluate our project work.\n Please share you results now with us.\n As mentioned in the beginning only the statistics will be shared and not you records.
